info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 03 at 1:58PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of central Illinois, east central Illinois and west central Illinois, including the following counties, in central Illinois, Christian, De Witt, Logan, Macon, McLean, Menard, Piatt, Sangamon and Shelby. In east central Illinois, Moultrie. In west central Illinois, Morgan and Scott. * WHEN...Through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A couple rounds of thunderstorms this afternoon through tonight will produce rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches on saturated soils. A few locations that see repeated rounds of thunderstorms may see rainfall amounts of 3 to 6 inches. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
